dt: {bc}relating to, derived from, or consisting of matter
{bc}of or relating to matter rather than form
{bc}of or relating to the subject matter of reasoning
{bc}being of a physical or worldly nature
{bc}relating to or concerned with physical rather than spiritual or intellectual things

pt: {sc}material{/sc} {sc}physical{/sc} {sc}corporeal{/sc} {sc}phenomenal{/sc} {sc}sensible{/sc} {sc}objective{/sc} mean of or belonging to actuality. {sc}material{/sc} implies formation out of tangible matter; used in contrast with {it}spiritual{/it} or {it}ideal{/it} it may connote the mundane, crass, or grasping.
{sc}physical{/sc} applies to what is perceived directly by the senses and may contrast with {it}mental, spiritual{/it}, or {it}imaginary{/it}.
{sc}corporeal{/sc} implies having the tangible qualities of a body such as shape, size, or resistance to force.

pt.t: artists have portrayed angels as {it}corporeal{/it} beings

pt: {sc}phenomenal{/sc} applies to what is known or perceived through the senses rather than by intuition or rational deduction.
{sc}sensible{/sc} stresses the capability of readily or forcibly impressing the senses.

pt.t: the earth's rotation is not {it}sensible{/it} to us

pt: {sc}objective{/sc} may stress material or independent existence apart from a subject perceiving it.

et: Middle English {it}materiel{/it}, from Middle French & Late Latin; Middle French, from Late Latin {it}materialis{/it}, from Latin {it}materia{/it} matter {ma}{mat|matter|}{/ma}
shortdef: relating to, derived from, or consisting of matter; especially : physical
of or relating to matter rather than form
